text: Has anyone done a zoho to HubSpot migration and would be willing to share any of the API code they have? Open to payment as well

Hi <@U05CAJG8D98>,

Have you checked which all objects will be synced as the endpoints would be depending on those? Field mapping & some cleanup might be required as well.
Just regular - contact, companies, deals and then ideally as much of activities as possible
Without wasting too much time here

Ok if you want to try if yourself for the standard objects you can use the HubSpot API: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/objects/contacts>

and here is some info about doing it for activities: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/import-and-export/import-objects>

But if you are looking for doing it as a project <@U0623BNGR5H> is your guy!
I’m faniliar with HubSpots API just not with Zohos
I know the process but just wanted to know if anyone who has done this already would share their migrations scripts

Ok but Zoho has good SDKs that you can use: <https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/sdk/server-side/nodejs-sdk.html>

And if you can utilize APIs it should be about mapping the fields.
What about object relations, does zoho have a similar association structure as HubSpot does?

Yes the queried object has relatedRecords to be fetched:

```<response> = zoho.crm.getRelatedRecords(<relation_name>, <parent_module_name>, <record_id>, 
<page>, <per_page>, <query_value>, <connection>);```
<https://www.zoho.com/deluge/help/crm/get-related-records.html>

Is it possible to integrate HubSpot with Virtual ATE?
We use <https://www.binotel.ua/ua>
The technical support of binotel suggested that integration is possible using an API key and webhooks.
So the question also is what the technical team of binotel need to give to technical team HubSpot to make integration and what your technical team should give for binotel?

The record is updated with Name, the full address and some other data like numberofemployees/annualrevenue.
I tried to update those 2 last fields after a modification in HubSpot but it does not work. It is like I have to wait 30 min to update it again...

You can choose to develop custom integration to synchronise data between the two platforms using custom API integration or even building a private app for this if needed; depends on the required scope. This method requires programming expertise to handle API requests and data mapping.
still investigating why the internal API doc generator is showing wrong authentication methods on the public site
<@U0623BNGR5H> Hi Ahmed! I hope you're well. Could you give more info about the integration with Hotjar to get the knowledge articles, please. I see the integration is limited.
Hey <@U07TF5ANJRM>, <https://help.hotjar.com/hc/en-us/articles/115009347167-HubSpot-Integration|check this out. >
Thanks guys, this perfectly worked. First time here so I didn't expect the case sensitivity
Does anyone had experience integrating HubSpot with Workday?

hey <@U07TCB5LBDF> , yeah sure, here's a screenshot & the raw text of the sourcestring (redacted):

```4XXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXfbPOST<https://XXXXXXXX.ngrok.io/api/integrations/HubSpot/tags{>"origin":{"portalId":47006505,"actionDefinitionId":166778471,"actionDefinitionVersion":1,"actionExecutionIndexIdentifier":null,"extensionDefinitionId":166778471,"extensionDefinitionVersionId":1},"inputFieldName":"tagsInput","fetchOptions":{"q":""},"objectTypeId":"0-1","fields":{},"portalId":47006505,"userId":25908434,"extensionDefinitionId":166778471,"extensionsDefinitionVersion":1,"inputFields":{}}```

Then dropped into the crypto hash function:
```crypto.createHash("sha256").update(sourceStringUTF8).digest("hex");```
and `bodyString` is simply `const bodyString = JSON.stringify(_req_.body || "");`
I have played with encode/decode URI components for the URL path (there isn't a query string so kind of pointless) as well as the body string, but nothing works
crazy, everything looks perfect. What did support say?
hit up the community forum and someone tagged some technical support people but nothing yet, been a week xD
all the other threads have the same code essentially but the answers didn't have any kind of real answer
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/V2-Signature-Validation-Just-Won-t-Work/m-p/1061426#M77720> - maybe I should ping those people directly or bump the thread idk
might as well yeah, this looks like an issue on their end
what's crazy is there are a handful of threads like this where people just cannot get V2 to match up

Hello there, I am trying to get a list of all my reports. Would be awesome to get some related data, too, such as create date, creator, ect.
Kinda need this: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/batch-export-a-list-of-all-reports-within-the-system/idi-p/754787>

Is there a way to accomplish this?
Hey Emmanuel! Sending you a DM.
Hello - how can we batch API usage with Salesforce integration?

Have feedback for us? Share it here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/feedback>

Hi all, quick questions about business units when creating a marketing email via the API. According to the API docs, I thought adding a business unit is optional. However I then get this error if I don't add it. Do you know why?

_Developers that have worked with Custom Workflow Actions_ -- Did you manage to get the HubSpot V2 Signature Auth to work/match? I can't for the life of me and want to see what others have done to get it working

Hey Austin, what language are you in? The signature validation can get tricky since you have to do crypto stuff - so you're getting into the nitty gritty of how the bits and bytes of the payload JSON are represented
hey Eric, I'm running in Node.js, you can see a bit of my code here on this ticket: (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/V2-Signature-Validation-Just-Won-t-Work/m-p/1061426>
I've been trying to throw in more decodeURI stuff, ensuring the string is UTF8 before hashing, etc and I usually wind up with the same result and it never matches the signature provided
here's a sample source string pre-hash

Hey Austin, the line

```const bodyString = JSON.stringify(req.body || "")```
has me concerned. You want to be looking at the exact, raw body that HubSpot is sending you. Here it looks like you might be re-formatting the body using the `JSON.stringify` method. It might be adding (or not adding) spaces which would affect the signature
Eric, you are probably right - I have Express automatically parsing JSON bodies as they come in so I need to get it back to it's original format - maybe I need to do something like this?
essentially capturing the raw body before it's altered by middleware
Yes, I think something like that could be the solution here.
looks pretty good. Are you using the correct key to generate the hash?
you'll find lots of those "did not expect" situations. :stuck_out_tongue:
yeah seems so, here's the HS dash and my code logging the same before hashing:
okay captured raw body, sadly still doesn't hash out right lol I'm truly at a loss

maybe the sourceString needs to be utf-8 first.
I don't really work with node.js
it is already yeah, we wen’t through that already :laughing:
yeah sorry I have two threads going, spread my questions far and wide in desperation lmao
not sure who to get in touch regarding this though
SJ Morris here in the community said I'm doing the right stuff sadly, just asking peers and hit up the forums in hopes of someone stepping in with assistance
<@U07SKR0FZNW> capturing the raw body to bypass any JSON parsing and subsequent stringifying that may mess with the body
good idea

so I've poured over these docs and I think they updated them really recently - check the code sample a little below this header: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/apps/authentication/validating-requests#validate-requests-using-the-v2-request-signature>
this is sample code for a POST request, they aren't even using the request body:
and they are specifying `ascii` from the buffer
yeah it's totally inconsistent... I thought my scrolling up and down the browser had me looking at 2 different things but nope.
but u said that your req body was empty so I figured that was irrelevant
it’s a long shot but what if you try to convert each string to utf-8 seperately then concat the string into one?
ah nah it's a POST
could do that yeah
yeah I need to figure out what account it's for, so I need the `portalId` from HubSpot... and I have no idea how to slap that onto the URL query string for a GET request
so I am forced to do a POST to capture it from the req body

yeah... just a terrible example really...
Hey let me describe this thing... then use and example that's a little different
even if I"m just fetching an array of objects to populate a Select field
lol yes
okay there EXACT example from that snippet, and it does NOT work
their*
Is this a private app that you have running outside of HubSpot?
well public app that hasn't gone through review or anything
just in test mode essentially, and I've done the OAuth handshake to be able to test it out in a test account

ah.. brand new to HubSpot.. been an engineer for over 25 years..mostly java and python.
just trying to be helpful while I also try to figure things out
I appreciate your time, I know nobody has to help me so it means the world
my pleasure.. I'm only part time busy these days, so I figure good karma and if people give me insight into HubSpotty stuff, then cool
yeah I'm just scratching the surface myself, I have CRM cards to set up next and probably some other sticky situations after that

this looks good damnit! :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
And u already said you were positive that the signing secret is the same as the one your using to verify...
and you checked that v2 was being used to sign
yeah gotta be, same secret I used to run through the OAuth and access my app from that HS test account
hum yeah the request header says V2 but for fun I was processing a V3 signature just to see, that also did not match as per the docs haha
hm then again, might not be the right one I think I may have found the issue, have to confirm
(I have created a test app and a prod app in HubSpot)

whats doing the sig generation?
Can you look at that and confirm it's doing what you expect?
and can you log the sig there?
not the one I get from HS, they just send that and then you build up a corresponding one using the request details to confirm it's legitimately HS
ah ok... they generate it when the form is submitted... or whatever triggers this flow?
and they don't provide a trace log?
anytime they send a request to your app
nope just the raw sig and tell you to build up yours and see if it matches
I'm not busy right now.. Let me dig a little and I'll reply later

okay so I think I know - the installed app was the production version, despite me (several times) doing the OAuth handshake locally after changing the client ID/Secret to the development values

so I removed the app from the HubSpot test account, but now I can't see the development app "installed" in HS despite me installing it
sucks that they don't have a "Cloudwatch" type thing where you can check events and logging within your account
can you skip oath and just use the private key?
I just did the dev oauth handshake again and the test HS account shows it installed under Installed Apps, but won't show me it in the Workflows installed apps section lol
oh.. you want it to be a public app
yeah def public eventually when it's all buttoned up
I can skip the validation for now in general but it feels dirty doing so haha

<@U07U4T7K9AL> - have you tried hardcoding the URI instead of building it from the Express request variables? Literally copy/paste the URL that you provide for the Webhook destination URL - that way, the only pieces you're pulling from variables are the Client Secret environment variable and the request body
wait you’re making ui cards?
I haven't, but I can try that out
is frontend with react?
not yet, Kilian, just trying to get Custom Workflow Actions working right now
oh
also, pretty sure the method should be an all caps "POST" method
my app yes, the CRM cards will be too I believe
did your url have parameters?
if so could be url encoding?
and, do you know what version of the signature you're receiving?
nah it's simple, just /api/integrations/HubSpot/tags
no query string
because I know there is a wrapper and by wrapping your components you can get out a context parameter and using this parameter you can get the portalId
ok I think I've been using POST, and the version should be v2 as per the signature version header
ah ok yeah that makes sense I think I read about the context wrapper

I've hit a roadblock now, I uninstalled the app and reinstalled it and while it appears in the account's Connected apps, it is missing from the Workflow "integrated apps" section (where it was before)
your code isn't trying to append the request body..

sorry I had removed it as a test since the docs didn't show it there either, but it's there now an
```    const sourceString = `${HubSpot_CLIENT_SECRET}${method}${uri}${JSON.stringify(req.body)}`;```
I also confirmed, the JSON stringify body is exactly the same as the raw body (pre-Express JSON Parsing)
ok... I'm just reaching and grasping for straws..
you can't force HubSpot to use v3?
yeah same, and now I have to find out why the app isn't showing anymore
supposedly not
the workflow actions API requests "use" the v2, however they do send both v2 and v3 in the request haha
interesting... does the v3 at least match?!
it did not sadly lol

assuming you're building for a Custom Workflow action? What happens if you get the definitions for your extension? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions#get-%2Fautomation%2Fv4%2Factions%2F%7Bappid%7D>

do you have an action that's `published:true`?
yeah I have two there, both published true
I even archived what I had and recreated them

they both are using CONTACT object types and I created a CONTACT based workflow but no cigar
```objectTypes: ["CONTACT"],```
Not sure if I'll be able to see anything different, but if you want you can DM me a link to the portal where the workflow is. (I'm a HubSpot employee)

where's your app currently running?
Just wondering if a uri is getting transformed behind some wall
Is there a way to capture the 4xx and 5xx error status and send it to an external URL via a webhook?
idk its either its an issue on HubSpots end or its something with the request body maybe you are sending to much data and it completely changes the generated hash or something idk

I was thinking to link it to something else... very simple... that isn't sending a body and params... then build up to a form or workflow trigger that has a little more info in it... make your situation as simple as possible at first.
I am building an API to return properties of a custom object, and I want to include the Associated deal in my data. What change needs to be done in the code?

I’m hitting  a dead-end with the HS Blog API that seems like a strange limitation, but maybe i’ve just been staring at it for too long.

We have 3 different filtering group ‘taxonomies’ (on the backend they all just use HubSpot tags) that are manually set in the page editor. I can query posts using the API for any combination of ID’s using tagid__in- is there no way to setup AND logic?

Two tags OR (working): <https://api.hubapi.com/cms/v3/blogs/posts?*tagId__in=112870976281,112870976282*>
Two tags AND (not working): <https://api.hubapi.com/cms/v3/blogs/posts?*tagId__in=112870976281&tagId__in=112870976282*>

Anyone solved for this before?

Hi <@U03N5FHUHQT>
I have been trying to replicate your result with no luck.
Would you have time to elaborate a little bit on the API calls you performed and the contents of the body?

okay so everything's running smoothly now, I spoke to a great HubSpot guy that gave me some transparency from their end

I had practically a desync issue where I had previously installed my prod app version then installed the dev version but HS only acknowledged the prod version this entire time so that's why the signatures never matched, the App ID was incorrect

I republished all of my workflow actions, removed the apps from the HS test account, re-did the oauth handshaking a few times for good measure and then found out that the sample code in the docs was actually just not working and my original approaches did work

Both the SDK approach as well as the manual string concat approach

I settled on using manual for now but should probably commit to the SDK approach. So moral of the story is to check _everything_ top to bottom! Thanks for the help guys, it's been a doozey haha

Here's the code that's in place and working well for V2. I believe V3 also works as I did test V3 against the workflow actions and they did actually match as well
still would like to iron out the GET request with the HS Portal ID query string param but this works for now

Hi <@U07TLEC1RHV>,
This will likely take me an hour to replicate. Keep in mind that I am not a developer and this has been over 4 months ago. Would it be ok if I do that tomorrow evening and send you the calls then?
And just to clearify: this was just for the mail, not for anything else. Notes should kinda work the same, but have not tested that.

Thanks <@U03N5FHUHQT>

`"hs_conversations_originating_thread_id": 7421287812`  and
`"hs_conversations_originating_message_id": "c2b1781f-9883-492d-a53b-86476d7a56c9"`  ?
